title: Four Honeydew cops in court for assault, murder of detainee
text:
Four police officers, stationed at the Honeydew police station in Gauteng, are expected to appear in the Randburg Magistrate's Court for the assault and murder of a detainee.

The constables, aged between 25 an 36, were arrested on Friday by the Independent Police Investigative Directorate (IPID).

IPID spokesperson Sontaga Seisa said the incident happened on Sunday, October 20.

"It is alleged that the four on-duty constables continuously punched and kicked the two arrested males until the 39-year-old male dropped down whilst in handcuffs," he said.

"The fact that the deceased dropped down and started bleeding did not deter the constables from assaulting and kicking him."

After the alleged assault, the policemen left the detainees in the holding cell.

Seisa said his cellmate alerted officer when he started to breathe abnormally, but they ignored the cellmate's plea.

"Later, the police removed the surviving assault victim and took him to Randburg police station for detention."

Seisa said the family of the deceased discovered that he was dead when they visited the police station.
description: Four Gauteng police officers, from Honeydew police station, are expected to appear in the Randburg Magistrate's Court for the assault and murder of a detainee.
